member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: This constructor creates an new instatance with a connection string

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This constructor creates an new instatance with a connection string
member.param: Identifer of the registered RFC server instance at SAP gateway
Host name of the SAP Gateway
Service name of the SAP gateway, where xx is usually the system number of the SAP application server
Specifies the code page (such as unicode or ascii) that the server is running in. The default is 1100.

member.summary: This constructor creates an new instatance with a connection string
member.param: Connection string used to register the RFC server at the SAP gateway
A SAPServerHost object that hosts the new SAPServer instance

member.summary: This constructor creates an new instatance with an array of parameters

member.summary: This constructor creates an new instatance with an array of parameters

A SAPServerHost object that hosts the new SAPServer instance

member.summary: This constructor creates an new instatance with a connection string

Host name of the SAP Gateway
Service name of the SAP gateway, where xx is usually the system number of the SAP application server
Specify SAP codepage 4103 or 4102 to run the RFC server in unicode mode.
A SAPServerHost object that hosts the new SAPServer instance

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.Start
member.summary: Call this method to start the RFC server instance

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.Stop
member.summary: Call this method to stop the RFC server instance

members.member: Call this method to pause the RFC server instance summary>
Call this method to resume the paused RFC server instance summary>

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.Run
member.summary: Thread star delegate for the RFC server instance

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.CheckTransaction(SAP.Connector.RfcTID)
member.summary: Callback method to be overrided by the derived class. The method should check if this tid has already been stored. If this tid is a new tid, save this tid, return 0; If this tid has already been stored, return 1. Inthe case of error, return -1.
member.param: transaction ID

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.CommitTransaction(SAP.Connector.RfcTID)
member.summary: Callback method to be overrided by the derived class. This method should commit the changes made by the CheckTransaction and the tRfc method itself.

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.RollbackTransaction(SAP.Connector.RfcTID)
member.summary: Callback method to be overrided by the derived class. This method should rollback the changes made by the CheckTransaction and the tRfc method itself.

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.ConfirmTransaction(SAP.Connector.RfcTID)
member.summary: Callback method to be overrided by the derived class. This method just need to remove the tid from the TID store.

member.summary: ProgramID used by SAP gateway to identify this SAPServer instance. This ID is not unoque

member.summary: If the SAPServer instance runs in unicode.

member.name: P:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.IsWorking
member.summary: If this SAPServer instance is working or waiting for request.

member.name: P:SAP.Connector.SAPServer.COMApartmentModel
member.summary: Indicates the COM apartment model of the worker thread created by a SAPServer instance. The default value of this property is Unknown. In a COM interop situation, it can be set to MTA or STA according to the threading model of the involved COM components, but only before starting the worker thread by calling method Start.

member.summary: Indicates the status of this SAPServer instance.

member.summary: Open a RFC connection with the property settings specified by . a RFC handle identifying the connection.

member.summary: Register RFC server connection with the property settings specified by . a RFC handle identifying the connection.

member.summary: Closes the RFC connection.

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPConnection.PrepareForPooling
member.summary: Clear the connection to be reused later. This method is used by connection pooling.
member.returns: The the representation of the connection that should go back into the pool. The function returns null, if the Connection is in a state that is shouldn't go into the pool. The default implementations returns "this".

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPConnection.GetSAPSSOTicket(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets SAP SSO or SAP SSO2 ticket for the user specified in
member.param: A connection string used to connect to the target SAP ssytem
1 or 2 to indicate the requested SAP SSO ticket version.
member.returns: A base64-encoded SAP SSO ticket. This ticket can re-used to open a new RFC connection to the same SAP system without having to provide user credential.

member.summary: Possible return values for method ISAPServerHost.OnSAPServerException

member.name: F:SAP.Connector.ActionOnServerException.Terminate
member.summary: Terminate the RFC server thread when a exception thrown

member.summary: Re-connect to the SAP gateway when a exception thrown

member.name: T:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost
member.summary: Container to host one or more SAPServer instances

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.OnServerException(SAP.Connector.SAPServer,System.Exception)
member.summary: Exception handler called when a hosted SAPServer instance throws an exception. The default handler returns ActionOnServerException.Terminate and will cuause the SAPServer instance stop to run.
member.param: the SAPServer instance that throws the exception.
The exception thrown by the the SAPServer instance

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.Add(SAP.Connector.SAPServer)
member.summary: Add a new SAPServer to the container

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.Start
member.summary: Start all SAPServer instances hosted in it.

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.Stop
member.summary: Stop all SAPServer instances hosted in it.

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.Pause
member.summary: Pause all SAPServer instances hosted in it.

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.Continue
member.summary: Resume all SAPServer instances hosted in it.

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.RemoveSAPServer(SAP.Connector.SAPServer)
member.summary: Remove a SAPServer instance from this container

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.RemoveAllSAPServers
member.summary: Remove all SAPServer instances from this container

member.name: M:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.WaitForExit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until all hosted SAPServer instances have terminated or the specified time elapses.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait.
member.returns: true if all SAPServer instances have terminated; false if any of the hosted SAPServer instances is still running after the amount of time specified by the millisecondsTimeout parameter has elapsed.

member.name: P:SAP.Connector.SAPServerHost.ServerHostStatus
member.summary: current status of the SAPServer instance
